metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3230 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: 389 Directory Server (formerly Fedora Directory Server) before 1.3.3.12 does not enforce the nsSSL3Ciphers preference when creating an sslSocket, which allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact by requesting to use a disabled cipher.

notes.Note: sbeattie> second ticket fixes regression if

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
